reviewText: Familiar with this series from pre-video days when they were first created. The combination of music, exceptional casting of voice actors and the animation made these so enjoyable we wanted to share them with grandchild. When they appeared in DVD we wanted to buy our favorites from the set.
An age old story told by an academy award winning actor and music by a grammy winning musician. Superb. Superior Quality.
Good for classroom use; this is a short but well done video with great narration by Denzel Washington.  I would view it again.
Great story. Enjoyable for all ages.  Great artwork and music!  Tall tales should be a staple for every child in America.

narrated by another favorite actor as well as a favorite artist. I'm a fan of animation and I was curious about this film as well as The Legend of Sleepy Hollow. I was so used to Disney's take on classics that I either didn't know the classic or just couldn't remember them. This particular tale is one I heard or saw too many spins on to know the correct one so I decided to take a peek. It was very well done and the ending was a bit of a shock but it was a great story!!!
Good story if you grew up learning about these. Wish they had Tall Tale on here because it would give a better aspect or a new aninmated version
This is a good, wholesome movie for children to watch.  Denzel Washington is a terrific narrator and the music is awesome.
My son loved it. He says that it was awesome. He enjoyed watching the show of strength and the songs can still be heard around my house. Great for young kids

Kids love this lively tale of one of America's African-American pioneers. In a time when reading and math overshadow history, this story segues into a discussion of the opening of the American West. It's funny, entertaining, and a great way to introduce tall tales to kids.

Saw this as a kid in elementary school and liked it. When I saw it on Amazon I said I bet my nieces would like this. So I bought it for them and they do like it. Now they are into the old stories and myths about not only John Henry but others as well.

My 4 year old loves this. It is told like a narrated picture book more than like animation. The narration and music are great. I have heard other versions of the story I like better. My favorite is the Disney short which includes some of the history of slavery, which I feel makes the story richer and more meaningful.
Denzel & B.B.? C'mon now, what's not to like!
My 3 year old grandson LOVES this video.  He watches it continuously.
I remember this story from my grammer school days, loved it then and now.  My kids were also very happy with the movie. Denzel's voice was the choice for this character. Well worth the purchase.
This is a great story. How can you go wrong with Denzel Washington and B.B. King. Helps keep alive American folktales.
